page.title: 01CALOW AND ARKWRIGHT
page.content: The section studied shows two distinct areas of population.Calow itself is a residential area with a mixture of private and council owned property. There is no industry and very few work oppurtunities.Most of the people travel out of Calow to work. Arkwright Town was built when the mine was sunk.The five rows of houses were for the miners and their families only.Recently the miners have been able to buy their houses and many have now been modernised and improved. Surrounding both settlements is farm land and small amounts of deciduous woodland. Both communities are linked by the main Chesterfield to Bolsover road. There are strong family links between the two communities.
